newsitem.title: FRANCE: Pathe seeks growth in audiovisual field.
newsitem.headline: Pathe seeks growth in audiovisual field.

text.p: PARIS, May 23, Reuter - French media company Pathe has a "strong will to grow" in the audiovisual sector and is considering opportunities, the company's assistant managing director Michel Crepon told a news conference on Friday.
Pathe announced on Wednesday it had bought 100 percent of the Voyage television channel from Landmark Communication Inc of the United States for an undisclosed sum.
"Voyage may post a small breakeven result by end 1998," said Voyage managing director Georges Bonopera, adding that the goal should be reached in any event by end 1999.
"Pathe has no intention of being a sleeping partner" and will play an active role in all of its current or future acquisitions, Crepon said.
He said his group planned to take part in the revival of European film industry production as well as in digital television, an area where further acquisitions may be considered.
"We hope to develop in digital television and programs," said Crepon.

Pathe owns around 17 percent of BSkyB and 20 percent of Canalsatellite. "We are an active partner in Canalsatellite," said Crepon. "If there were an opportunity, we would increase our share" in the Canal Plus digital service.
Canalsatellite is held 70 percent by Canal Plus, 20 percent by Pathe and 10 percent by Generale des Eaux.
